result.execSummary:
The defendant Israel Ruelas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care as well as psychological evaluation and follow through with recommendations. Must comply with mother's house rules if defendant lives with mother. No violent contact with mother or other family members and persons in his mother's home. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 10-25-2017:  Defendant granted additional credit for time served that was not included on defendant's original JOC for this count (credit was list on the JOC for Ct. 4 previously but missing on JOC for Ct. 5)
Concurrent with: 14CF1343

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care; psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment. No contact with mother unless approved by agent and mother.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Must pay all costs previously assessed. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Israel Ruelas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties have received and reviewed the report from Dr. Pankiewicz. Neither party objects to the findings. The Court has also reviewed a report from Dr. Luzi who also opines that the defendant is competent.
Upon plea to 14CF1349, Ct 1, Ct 2 will be DRI-9 mos RCJ/CFTS; 14CF1343, Ct 1 and Ct 2, Ct 3 is DRI; probation; 15CF369, plea to Ct 4 and Ct 5 - balance DRI; w/held sentence - 2 yrs probation.

BTC: Dr. Pankiewicz opines that the deftendant is competent in all three matters as does Dr. Luzi in the follow up report dated 9/11. The Court will adopt those findings and find the defendant competent to proceed.
           The matter is to be set over - the defendant is not understanding cmpletely today
Dr. Mary Kay Luzi

Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Lori A. Kuehn.  Defendant Israel Ruelas in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Kuehn indicates that she went to RCJ yesterday and she does not feel defendant is understanding what she is saying to him. Ms. Kuehn again raises competency. The Court conducts colloquy with the defendant. Defense indicates defendant will not sign change of plea forms.

Defendant now wants to go to trial. Ms. Kuehn is still concerned about competency. Ms. Kuehn indicates that she is taking a personal extended leave and asks to withdraw.

BTC: Ms. Kuehn may withdraw. New counsel to be appointed. Competency exam is ordered. 14CF1343 will be tried first. All files to be set for JT. Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims, CR and MR (person, property, residence or family). A third party may go to the residence to obtain the Defendant's personal belongings.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Israel Ruelas in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Israel Ruelas in custody.  Robin Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
